description: Scoring rubric for requirements readiness assessment

scoring.1.0: All functional, non-functional, security, interface, and data requirements captured. No critical gaps.
scoring.0.8: Most requirements captured. 1-2 minor gaps in non-critical areas.
scoring.0.6: Core functional requirements present. Missing some security or interface specs.
scoring.0.4: Only high-level capabilities described. Significant gaps in detail.
scoring.0.2: Minimal requirements. Missing entire categories (security, data, interfaces).

completeness.auto_check: gap_count == 0 and all required categories have >= 1 requirement

scoring.1.0: Zero ambiguous terms. All requirements use measurable, testable language.
scoring.0.8: 1-3 minor ambiguities. Core requirements are clear.
scoring.0.4: 7-10 ambiguities. Multiple requirements use vague terms.
scoring.0.2: 10+ ambiguities. Most requirements are vague or subjective.
scoring.0.0: Requirements are entirely qualitative with no measurable criteria.

feasibility.description: Can these requirements be built within the stated constraints?

scoring.1.0: All requirements feasible within budget, timeline, and technology constraints.
scoring.0.8: Most feasible. 1-2 may require trade-offs but are achievable.
scoring.0.6: Several requirements push constraints. Scope negotiation needed.
scoring.0.4: Multiple conflicting constraints. Significant scope reduction required.
scoring.0.2: Major feasibility concerns. Technology or timeline constraints severely limit scope.
scoring.0.0: Requirements are not feasible within any reasonable interpretation of constraints.

feasibility.auto_check: no requirements flagged as infeasible by architect assessment

compliance.description: Do requirements address NIST 800-53 controls for the impact level?

scoring.1.0: All applicable control families addressed. ATO boundary impact assessed.
scoring.0.8: Most control families addressed. Minor gaps in low-impact areas.
scoring.0.6: Core security controls addressed. Missing several families.
scoring.0.4: Only basic security mentioned. No systematic control coverage.
scoring.0.2: Minimal security awareness. Critical control families missing.

testability.description: Do requirements have measurable acceptance criteria?

scoring.1.0: All requirements have BDD-style acceptance criteria (Given/When/Then).
scoring.0.8: 80%+ have testable criteria. Remaining have clear intent.
scoring.0.6: 60-80% have some form of acceptance criteria.
scoring.0.4: 40-60% have criteria. Many are vague or untestable.
scoring.0.2: Under 40% have any form of acceptance criteria.
scoring.0.0: No acceptance criteria defined for any requirement.
